tweets.text: @vgr Ok, shooting for 3 tweets per like, or minimum of 30 tweets, whichever is higher. Topic, my idea with permission from @vgr, life and happiness in your 20s. Credentials: alive, happy 28 year old.
@vgr 1. I'm late to this, but aspire to genuine, radical honesty.
@vgr 2. At first you strive for coolness, not realizing it is authenticity. Authenticity is at base honesty. So start by being honest.
@vgr 3. Honesty is not word vomit. Sometimes--a lot of the time--the honest answer is "I don't know". Say it like you mean it, and find out the answer.

@vgr 4. That means trying to drop the pretensions, the affectations, anything that's more a calculated attempt at controlling other people's conception of you than an honest representation of who you are, your taste, opinion, or your feelings.

@vgr 5. That means being vulnerable, something I admit a lot of 20 year olds are hormonally challenged by (desire to be liked > earned self-assurance). But if you honestly like something, decent people will respect you for it (or more likely, simply not care).
@vgr 6. Those that minimize, belittle, or worse, are likely doing it out of their own desire to be liked. The appropriate reaction is to not outsource any of your self-esteem to them.

@vgr 7. "What if I don't like anything? What if I'm uninteresting?" Quit video games and delete your social media. You have proclivities, interests, and opinions/reactions to the world around you. They just haven't had air.

@vgr 8. This is where I talk about picking up a rewarding, physically active hobby. I agree with @yashkaf that the metric is the amount of joy it brings. Huge plug for my hobby, gymnastics: https://t.co/G1UTuF0WEA

@vgr @yashkaf 9. Social sports, bike rides, rock climbing, group fitness, &c are sources of MANY good things. Stimulation, anti-depressant effects, physical health, mobility; dating pool of folks who also like being fit; network of friends for... goodness, all the reasons friends are good!

@vgr @yashkaf 10. Special shoutout to a) social dance, i.e. partner dancing. In your city there are tons of kind people of all sexes involving themselves in the most sublimely enjoyable social physical activity that involve clothes: Salsa, Swing, Bachata, Lindy, Cha-cha, and other dancing.

@vgr @yashkaf 11. And shoutout b) weight training at your local gym. Contrary to your perception in high school and college, the gym is not the exclusive domain of meatheads. It's a deeply rewarding place that simulates our ancestral environment where you pick up heavy things many times.

@vgr @yashkaf 12. To hesitant females: you will not "accidentally get bulky". People train intensely for years to barely attain bodybuilder physique. You will only get more toned, look sexier, and feel better. You don't drive to NYC and "accidentally land on Moon"
@vgr @yashkaf 13. Sex. Where is it, how does one get it, what color is it? Whoo boy, okay, where to start.

@vgr @yashkaf 14. There are fun, willing partners out there for (almost) everyone but there's the matter of finding them and having some basic shared chemistry. Rule #1, primarily for guys: do not be a creep.

@vgr @yashkaf 15. I know that sexlessness can be overwhelming in the desperation and frustration it imparts. But interacting with others for the sole objective of having sex is generally *very* off-putting. This off-putting-ness is not diminished by your perceived unfairness of the situation.

@vgr @yashkaf 16. First realize that implicitly you must provide something of value to the other person. Cultivating that value is not a shameful pursuit. Don't let your aversion towards "players" spill over to an aversion towards self-improvement and development.

@vgr @yashkaf 17. What's high value? In a nutshell, and besides physical health (and beauty if you're so endowed): a secure & confident demeanor born of valid reasons, like intelligence, wit, wealth, friends, and "options". You can work on any of these.
@vgr @yashkaf 18. And it's orange. Sex is the color of orange.

@vgr @yashkaf 19. For women, sex is a much easier affair (I'm proceeding on the solidly-researched grounds of sex differences). Physical appearance is your primary constraint, but you could, on avg, sleep with 70%+ of unmarried (and some of the married) men at most bars with minimal effort.

@vgr @yashkaf 20. The reason there are few (any?) female incels is because sex is not the limiting factor of their happiness. But for women, and certainly many men, the limiting factor is a complementary, compatible, suitable partner, i.e. a long-term relationship.

@vgr @yashkaf 21. Before proceeding on to relationships, I want to acknowledge that relationships are generally best for healthy, already-whole people. Relationships enrich their lives. Relationships end poorly for people with gaping, human-sized holes in their hearts.

@vgr @yashkaf 22. The gaping hole needs addressing. I could have said this earlier but to quote a wise but forgotten tweet: Your parents fucked you up. It's ok, or maybe it isn't, but regardless, go see a therapist. Find out how. Learn to be gentle with yourself.
